description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Windows Network Address Translation (NAT) remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-38119):

1. Identify the specific Windows version and build number of your system from the list provided in the post.
2. Download and apply the relevant KB update package:
   - For Windows 11 Version 24H2: [KB5043080](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043080)
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2: [KB5043076](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043076)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2: [KB5043064](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043064)
   - Additional updates available for other versions as listed.
3. Restart your system after installation to ensure the changes take effect.

**Details**:
- This update resolves a critical vulnerability that could allow remote code execution. Be sure to apply the correct update according to your system's build and version.
- Further information and options for each update can be accessed through the provided URLs. 

**Preconditions**:
- Backup critical data before proceeding.
- Ensure that you are running the supported versions of Windows listed above.
